channel.title: Data Structures on Journalism with R
channel.description: Recent content in Data Structures on Journalism with R

item.title: Data structures in R
item.description: Vectors A vector is a sequence of data elements of the same basic type. The parts that consist of a vector are called components or elements. vec1 <- c(1,4,6,8,10) vec1 ## [1] 1 4 6 8 10 A vector vec is explicitly constructed by the concatenation function c(). vec1[5] ## [1] 10 Elements in vectors can be addressed by standard [i] indexing vec1[3] <- 12 vec1 ## [1] 1 4 12 8 10 One of the elements in the array is replaced with a new number.
